newsitem.title: UK: SBS Group jumps to premium on AIM debut.
newsitem.headline: SBS Group jumps to premium on AIM debut.

text.p: Shares in IT recruitment agency SBS Group Plc leapt to a 17.5 percent premium on their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM).
The shares, issued at 100p, jumped to 117-1/2p by 1427 GMT in volume dealers estimated to be over 250,000 shares.
"This may be a small issue but we have seen some healthy buying," said one dealer.
SBS raised about 1.2 million stg to provide working capital, finance future acquisitions and reduce gearing.

The group markets its services to around 4,500 organisations, the majority having large IT departments. These include Banque Paribas, BZW, Citicorp, London Clearing House, London Electricity, Norwich Union NRU.CN and Prudential Portfolio Managers.
SBS said in the year to August 31 1996, it made pre-tax profits of 400,000 stg on sales of 15.2 million stg.
